fields.name: RescueMe Pro
fields.description: This product allows the RescueMe contacts to track the person in an emergency situation.

fields.description: The most complete RescueMe product.
The RescueMe contact contains useful information about people who receives the rescue message.

fields.definition: The Common Alerting Protocol (CAP) is an XML-based data format for exchanging public warnings and emergencies between alerting technologies. CAP allows a warning message to be consistently disseminated simultaneously over many warning systems to many applications. CAP increases warning effectiveness and simplifies the task of activating a warning for responsible officials.
It represents a person to be contacted in an emergency situation. It includes relevant information like e-mail, phone number, Facebook ID, Twitter ID.
It is a collection of contacts sorted in an alphabetical order.
It is the way that the contact will receive the emergency message (e.g. e-mail, SMS, tweet).
It is a telephone number that allows contacting with local emergency services. The emergency number depends on the region.

A geographic coordinate system is a coordinate system that enables every location on the Earth to be specified by a set of numbers and/or letters. The coordinates are often chosen such that one of the numbers represents vertical position, and two or three of the numbers represent horizontal position. The Global Positioning System (GPS) is an example of technology for realizing the GCS (it is available in most of the smartphones using GCS).
Examples of GCSs are: 

- A global or spherical coordinate system such as latitude-longitude. These are often referred to as geographic coordinate systems. 

- Other kind of systems: Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM), Albers Equal Area, or Robinson, all of which (along with numerous other map projection models) provide various mechanisms to project maps of the earth's spherical surface onto a two-dimensional Cartesian coordinate plane. Projected coordinate systems are referred to as map projections.
It is the exact point, on the Earth's surface, retrieved by the geographic coordinate system.
A region is a medium-scale area where an emergency number is shared.
A way or course taken by the User in getting from a starting point to a destination.
Short Message Service (SMS) is a text messaging service that allows the exchange of short text messages between mobile devices.
Microblogging service. It is a site where the user can share small messages.
Social Web Site. It is a site where the user can share information with other contacts.

The Global Positioning System (GPS) is a space-based satellite navigation system that provides location information in all weather conditions, where there is an unobstructed line of sight to four or more GPS satellites.

fields.title: Bruno's absence on July 2013

fields.note: All developers are taking a training on Test-Driven Development for iOS applications. It will take two weeks. The developers have to be able to write code according to TDD practices until September 19th.
fields.title: TDD training for two weeks
